Bibliography

1

Michael F Modest. Chapter 10 - The Radiative Transfer Equation in Participating Media (RTE). Academic Press, Boston, third edition edition, 2013. ISBN 978-0-12-386944-9.

2

Michael F Modest. Chapter 16 - The Method of Spherical Harmonics (PN-Approximation). Academic Press, Boston, third edition edition, 2013. ISBN 978-0-12-386944-9.

3

Gautham Krishnamoorthy. A computationally efficient p1 radiation model for modern combustion systems utilizing pre-conditioned conjugate gradient methods. Applied Thermal Engineering, 119:197–206, 2017.

4

CM Dixon, JD Yan, and MTC Fang. A comparison of three radiation models for the calculation of nozzle arcs. Journal of Physics D: Applied Physics, 37(23):3309, 2004.

5

WD Joubert. Lamg: los alamos multigrid code reference manual. 2003.

6

David B Carrington and Vincent A Mousseau. Preconditioning and solver optimization ideas for radiative transfer. In Heat Transfer Summer Conference, volume 47314, 787–796. 2005.

7

Klaus Stuben. Algebraic multigrid (amg): an introduction with applications. gmd-forschungszentrum informationstechnik. 1999.

8

Marzio Sala and Raymond S Tuminaro. A new petrov–galerkin smoothed aggregation preconditioner for nonsymmetric linear systems. SIAM Journal on Scientific Computing, 31(1):143–166, 2008.

9

Iulian Stroia, Lucian Mihai Itu, Cosmin Ioan Nita, Laszlo Lazar, and Constantin Suciu. Gpu accelerated geometric multigrid method: comparison with preconditioned conjugate gradient. 2015 IEEE High Performance Extreme Computing Conference (HPEC), pages 1–6, 2015.

10

J Gerardin, N Seiler, P Ruyer, L Trovalet, and P Boulet. P1 approximation, mda and ida for the simulation of radiative transfer in a 3d geometry for an absorbing scattering medium. Journal of Quantitative Spectroscopy and Radiative Transfer, 113(2):140–149, 2012.
